intro: Trachymene microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed devil's bit, is a herbaceous perennial native to Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, and its delicate appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant collections.
